jobs.title: IT Technical Lead - Customer Applications
jobs.location: Multiple Locations (Wilmington, DE | Colorado Springs, CO | Mississauga, ON, Canada)
jobs.shortDescription: Lead the technical design and implementation of entitlement management and software licensing platforms for a pharmaceutical/biotech organization.
jobs.fullDescription:
Enat Solution, on behalf of our client in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry, is seeking a highly experienced IT Technical Lead – Customer Applications to architect and implement a next-generation entitlement management and software licensing platform.

The ideal candidate will provide strong technical leadership, drive the design of scalable solutions, and work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful implementation and long-term adoption. This position follows a hybrid model (3 onsite / 2 remote).
responsibilities: Lead the end-to-end technical design and implementation of entitlement and software licensing solutions
Develop deep expertise in licensing and entitlement platforms to ensure best-practice adoption
Architect scalable B2B license management and monetization solutions for software products
Ensure alignment with enterprise architecture, compliance requirements, and IT policies
Partner with cross-functional business teams, product teams, and stakeholders to define requirements and deliver optimal solutions
Guide teams in integrating entitlement systems with enterprise platforms such as ERP and other backend systems
Solve day-to-day operational challenges and implement optimizations to improve system performance
Deliver clear technical documentation, presentations, and communications for global stakeholders
Drive seamless integration with backend ERP systems and customer-facing applications
Ensure compliance with privacy and regulatory frameworks such as PII, GDPR, and CFR
Implement secure solutions using AWS access control and industry-standard practices
qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
8+ years of experience in core computer science principles, algorithms, and enterprise architecture
2+ years as a technical lead guiding medium to large teams
Expertise in designing IT enterprise solutions using both custom-built and off-the-shelf technologies
Strong experience with backend integration involving ERP platforms
Background in building customer-facing applications and understanding of usability principles
Proficiency in backend scripting languages such as JavaScript/TypeScript (Node.js) or Python
Hands-on experience with AWS services (storage, caching, API Gateway, IAM)
Strong understanding of B2B licensing and software monetization concepts
Experience working in Agile/SCRUM environments
Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder engagement skills
Strong attention to detail, deadline-driven, and able to work independently
benefits: Competitive compensation package
Hybrid work arrangement (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage
401(k) with company match
Professional development & advancement opportunities
Occasional travel for cross-site collaboration
jobs.aboutCompany: Our client is a leading pharmaceutical/biotech organization seeking to implement next-generation entitlement management and software licensing platforms. They value technical excellence, innovation, and strong leadership in building scalable enterprise solutions.

jobs.title: Senior Digital Transformation Engineer (Manufacturing | ERP & Automation)
jobs.shortDescription: Lead enterprise-wide digital transformation initiatives across ERP, automation, and system integrations for a leading manufacturing organization.
jobs.fullDescription:
Enat Solution is partnering with a leading manufacturing organization to hire a Senior Digital Transformation Engineer. This role is ideal for a technical professional who can bridge business and technology leading modern digital initiatives, optimizing systems, and driving automation across enterprise operations.

You will help transform legacy systems into integrated, scalable, and efficient digital platforms while working closely with leaders across IT, Finance, Operations, and Engineering.
responsibilities: Lead enterprise-wide digital transformation initiatives across ERP, order management, fulfillment, eCommerce, and system integrations
Mentor and guide software developers & digital engineers; support professional development and technical excellence
Serve as an internal consultant to identify process bottlenecks and deliver scalable automated solutions
Manage external vendors and offshore development teams ensuring quality delivery and adherence to timelines
Develop and maintain Python automation tools (Pandas, NumPy) for data workflows, APIs, and reporting
Partner with Finance/Operations to build reports, reconcile inventory, and improve analytics capabilities
Evaluate technology platforms (ERP, MES, CMMS, B2B/B2C, analytics, personalization tools) and make recommendations
Create business cases with ROI analysis for digital investments and transformation initiatives
Oversee websites, domains, and analytics tools with strong focus on compliance (GDPR, CCPA)
Collaborate with IT/Help Desk to document infrastructure and ensure business continuity planning
qualifications: 6+ years of digital transformation or IT engineering experience
Strong background in ERP systems, automation, and digital architecture
Proficiency with Python (Pandas, NumPy)
Experience managing development teams and external vendors
Solid understanding of modern digital platforms and enterprise architectures
Bachelor's Degree required
benefits: Performance-based bonus program
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage
Paid time off & holidays
401(k) with company match
Professional development & advancement opportunities
Employee discount programs
jobs.aboutCompany: Our partner is a leading manufacturing organization in the pharmaceuticals and manufacturing industry. They are undergoing digital transformation to modernize legacy systems into integrated, scalable, and efficient digital platforms.

jobs.title: Executive Operations Manager
jobs.shortDescription: Oversee day-to-day operations and provide executive support for a mission-driven humanitarian organization.
jobs.fullDescription:
Enat Solution is seeking an Executive Operations Manager on behalf of our client, a mission-driven humanitarian organization dedicated to protecting life and delivering critical support in some of the world's most challenging environments.

This role is ideal for a candidate who thrives on structure, organization, and operational precision. You will oversee day-to-day operations, support the CEO, coordinate administrative workflows, and ensure internal processes run efficiently across programs, partnerships, and logistics.

This is an opportunity to contribute to meaningful, high-impact humanitarian work while supporting leaders operating in dynamic environments.
responsibilities: Manage daily administrative functions, calendars, and task tracking
Supervise and coordinate administrative staff, contractors, and volunteers
Maintain organization-wide schedules, operational documents, and tracking systems
Provide high-level executive support to the CEO (briefings, prep, follow-ups, reporting)
Assist with travel logistics, events, and partner coordination
Develop, improve, and enforce internal procedures for communication and documentation
Uphold strict confidentiality and data protection protocols
Act as a primary liaison between field teams, partners, donors, and vendors
Track program performance metrics, deliverables, and partner feedback
Prepare monthly or quarterly reports and operational updates for leadership
Maintain contact databases, partnership records, and tracking spreadsheets
Support communications and documentation for humanitarian and medical missions
Assist in procurement, shipping logistics, and compliance with export/customs regulations
Implement and maintain document control processes for sensitive materials
Coordinate with accounting/finance teams on timesheets, reimbursements, and vendor payments
Prepare executive summaries, operational briefings, and donor-facing updates
Draft official correspondence, letters, and organizational communication templates
Maintain standardized document formats and communication guidelines
Support proposal development and donor reporting requirements
Assist with internal planning, training sessions, and team coordination meetings
Optimize digital filing and knowledge-management systems (Microsoft 365, SharePoint, Teams)
qualifications: 5+ years of experience in operations, executive support, or administrative management (nonprofit, defense, or government sector strongly preferred)
Strong proficiency in Microsoft 365 (Teams, SharePoint, Excel, Outlook)
Exceptional written, organizational, and multitasking abilities
Experience with CRM, project management, or workflow tools is a plus
Ability to work independently, manage sensitive information, and uphold professionalism
U.S. Citizen and able to pass background verification
Military background or military spouse highly preferred
benefits: Compensation: $40 - $50/hour
Full-Time Equivalent position with meaningful humanitarian impact
Support elite Special Operations Veterans and global crisis response efforts
Occasional travel for event support or coordination
Opportunity to contribute to life-saving services in vulnerable communities
Work with highly skilled professionals in dynamic environments
jobs.aboutCompany: Our client is a mission-driven humanitarian organization dedicated to protecting life and delivering critical support in some of the world's most challenging environments. The team is composed of highly skilled professionals including elite Special Operations Veterans who bring leadership, resilience, and excellence to global crisis response and aid efforts.

jobs.title: Senior Database & Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.shortDescription: Design and maintain high-availability, cloud-based data systems for a global technology company powering data-driven decision-making in the hospitality industry.
jobs.fullDescription:
Enat Solution is seeking an experienced Senior Database & Infrastructure Engineer on behalf of a global technology company that powers data-driven decision-making for the hospitality industry.

The ideal candidate is a hands-on technologist who thrives on building and maintaining high-availability, cloud-based data systems that support mission-critical applications across international clients. You'll help design, optimize, and scale infrastructure that enables hotels and hospitality teams worldwide to make smarter, faster business decisions.
responsibilities: Design and implement high-availability database systems ensuring performance, reliability, and scalability
Manage and optimize cloud infrastructure supporting large-scale, distributed environments
Monitor and fine-tune database performance to ensure zero downtime operations
Leverage open-source technologies to automate workflows and improve data delivery
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business goals into technical solutions
Continuously evaluate and integrate new technologies to enhance performance and efficiency
qualifications: 5+ years of professional experience in Database Administration or Infrastructure Engineering
Deep expertise in PostgreSQL (design, tuning, replication, indexing, query optimization)
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Strong understanding of virtualization, containers, and CI/CD pipelines
Proven ability to maintain zero-downtime production systems
Excellent problem-solving skills, documentation discipline, and communication ability
benefits: Compensation: $50 - $80/hour (based on experience)
Work on cutting-edge, global data systems that truly make an impact
Collaborate with a passionate and highly skilled international team
Enjoy a flexible remote schedule and long-term project stability
Partner with a reputable U.S.-based recruiting and consulting agency Enat Solution dedicated to connecting exceptional tech talent with meaningful opportunities
jobs.aboutCompany: Our partner is a global technology company that powers data-driven decision-making for the hospitality industry. They support mission-critical applications across international clients, enabling hotels and hospitality teams worldwide to make smarter, faster business decisions.

jobs.title: Database Engineer / Administrator (PostgreSQL + Retool)
jobs.shortDescription: Build and optimize a scalable PostgreSQL database for a leading automotive manufacturing company's Product Information Management system.
jobs.fullDescription:
Enat Solution is partnering with a leading automotive manufacturing and restoration company that produces custom interior components for classic and vintage vehicles. They're building a powerful Product Information Management (PIM) system that will transform how product data, pricing, and fitment information are managed — and we're looking for an experienced Database Engineer/Administrator to bring this system to life.

This is your chance to join a growing operation and own the data architecture and tooling behind an entire manufacturing workflow.
responsibilities: Finalize and implement a scalable PostgreSQL / Supabase database
Optimize performance, indexing, and relational design for complex vehicle fitment data
Develop Retool interfaces for non-technical users (internal tools for customer service and quoting)
Handle data migration and ensure data integrity between systems
Document database schema and architecture for future integration (Shopify, inventory, etc.)
Build intuitive dashboards and lookup tools for part fitment, pricing, and product configuration
qualifications: 3+ years of professional experience as a Database Engineer, DBA, or Data Architect
Expert knowledge of PostgreSQL (schema design, optimization, indexing)
Experience using Retool to build internal dashboards or tools
Familiarity with Supabase, SQL, and data migration best practices
Strong understanding of relational database design and normalization
Proficiency with Git/GitHub for version control
English fluency (Spanish a plus)
benefits: Compensation: $45 – $60/hour (based on experience)
Direct collaboration with experienced business owners
Work on a technically challenging and rewarding project
Flexible remote schedule with potential for long-term extension
Join an established U.S.-based company modernizing its operations with cutting-edge tools
jobs.aboutCompany: Our partner is a leading automotive manufacturing and restoration company producing custom interior components for classic and vintage vehicles. They are modernizing their operations with cutting-edge tools and seeking talented professionals to drive their digital transformation.

jobs.title: Respiratory Care Practitioner
jobs.shortDescription: Join our respiratory therapy team and deliver exceptional patient care in a leading medical center.
jobs.fullDescription:
We are seeking a dedicated and skilled Respiratory Care Practitioner to join a leading medical center in Spokane, WA. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a solid understanding of modern respiratory therapy practices and will work collaboratively with physicians, nurses, and interdisciplinary care teams to deliver exceptional patient care.

In this role, you'll play a key part in improving patient outcomes through clinical expertise, compassion, and commitment to quality care.
responsibilities: Perform all aspects of respiratory care, including oxygen and aerosol therapy, ventilator management, airway clearance, and emergency interventions
Collaborate with physicians and nursing staff to plan and implement individualized care plans
Monitor and evaluate patients' responses to treatment and adjust care accordingly
Maintain accurate and detailed patient documentation and reports
Participate in continuing education and maintain all required certifications and competencies
Adhere to all hospital, departmental, and regulatory policies and standards
qualifications: Active Washington State Respiratory Care Practitioner License (required)
Basic Life Support (BLS) certification through the American Heart Association (AHA)
Education or training sufficient to meet certification, licensure, or registration requirements
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a commitment to compassionate, patient-centered care
benefits: Comprehensive health coverage, retirement plan with employer matching
Generous paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick days)
Opportunity to work within a respected, mission-driven healthcare organization
Supportive and inclusive work environment that values growth, collaboration, and diversity
Relocation assistance may be available for highly qualified candidates
jobs.aboutCompany: Our organization provides high-quality, compassionate care across multiple states through home health, hospice, infusion therapy, and community care programs. We are committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for both our patients and our team members.

jobs.title: Nurse Manager - Home Infusion Pharmacy
jobs.shortDescription: Lead our Home Infusion Pharmacy team with clinical expertise and compassionate leadership.
jobs.fullDescription:
We are seeking an experienced and compassionate Nurse Manager to lead our Home Infusion Pharmacy team. This individual will oversee clinical operations, ensure high-quality patient care, and support a collaborative work environment for nursing and pharmacy staff serving patients in their homes.

You will play a key role in coordinating interdisciplinary care, managing staff performance, maintaining compliance with healthcare regulations, and helping improve patient outcomes through innovation and leadership.
responsibilities: Oversee daily operations of the Home Infusion Department
Supervise and mentor nursing and pharmacy staff
Coordinate interdisciplinary care for patients receiving home infusion therapy
Ensure compliance with quality standards, safety protocols, and documentation requirements
Develop and implement departmental policies, procedures, and performance goals
Monitor staffing levels and productivity standards
Support staff development and training initiatives
qualifications: Active RN license in Washington State (Oregon license preferred)
Bachelor's degree in Nursing or related healthcare field (or equivalent experience)
4+ years of home infusion or home health nursing experience
2+ years in a supervisory or nurse management role
Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills
Passion for patient-centered, holistic care
benefits: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
401(k) with employer match
Paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick days)
Tuition reimbursement and professional development support
Employee wellness and family care programs
jobs.aboutCompany: Our organization provides high-quality, compassionate care across multiple states through home health, hospice, infusion therapy, and community care programs. We are committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for both our patients and our team members.
